result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daryl Deangelo Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daryl Deangelo Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Daryl Deangelo Williams.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held.  Atty. Wentz requests a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daryl Deangelo Williams in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Daryl Deangelo Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held via zoom. Attorney Wentz needs additional time to review offer with client. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daryl Deangelo Williams in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz is requesting a status date to continue negotiations.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-13-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Speedway, 5490 South 76th Street, Greendale, Wisconsin, JT.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Daryl Deangelo Williams in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Daryl Deangelo Williams not in court.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/09/2022@230p
